result.execSummary:
The defendant Cornell L Hutchison was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Felon Possess Firearm, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(2)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

miscConds.notes: Provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank; pay all appropriate costs. Pay all applicable court costs and surcharges. All costs and surcharges to be paid during the period of probation. Any unpaid amount is ordered converted to a civil judgment. If revoked, DOC shall collect up to 25% of prison funds. Remaining balance to be paid during the period of ES. Any unpaid amount is ordered converted to a civil judgment.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor. Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

- Complete Dosage Probation Program.
- AODA assessment and follow through with recommended programming.
- Maintain absolute sobriety.
- No new offenses.
- Cooperate with agent.
- Complete and follow through with all programming and conditions deemed appropriate by agent.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Cornell L Hutchison

records.addlTxt: Justice Point Pretrial Report, filed.

Defense counsel contacts the Court, counsel is not available for sentencing hearing tomorrow, 10/29/15.  Sentencing hearing adjourned to 11/4/15 at 8:30am in br. 35. ADA Stingl notified. Court imposes and stays a warrant for jurisdictional purposes until next date. Defense counsel to notify defendant of new date.

Defendant Cornell L Hutchison in court with attorney Richard Jeffrey Carpenter.  Denis John Stingl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm, body armor, or ammunition.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.


Case is adjourned for sentencing in Branch 35.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 29, 2015 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Cornell L Hutchison in court with attorney Richard Jeffrey Carpenter.  Denis John Stingl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court is in trial.  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 7.   All parties notified as of August 03, 2015 this case is assigned to Judge Rosa, Branch 35, in room 629 of the courthouse.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for 09-28-2015 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Cornell L Hutchison in court with attorney Richard Jeffrey Carpenter.  Denis John Stingl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 7.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for 07-08-2015 at 01:30 pm.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Cornell L Hutchison in court with attorney Richard Jeffrey Carpenter.  Denis John Stingl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case adjourned for further negotiations.   Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 7.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for 06-09-2015 at 01:30 pm.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Cornell L Hutchison in court with attorney Richard Jeffrey Carpenter.  Denis John Stingl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
FINAL ADJOURNMENT.  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 7.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for 04-30-2015 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Cornell L Hutchison in court with attorney Richard Jeffrey Carpenter.  Denis John Stingl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 7.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for 03-30-2015 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Attorney Mary Dorothy Scholle in court, defendant Cornell L Hutchison not in court, in custody.  Nicole Sheldon for Denis John Stingl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
NO COURT FILE.  Bail motion by defense argued and granted by the Court.  Court removes the defendant from GPS monitoring.  Defendant is turned over to Justice Point for monitoring (drug testing and a 6pm curfew).
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Electronic Monitoring.

Attorney Mary D. Scholle in court, defendant Cornell L Hutchison not in court, in custody.  Denis John Stingl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Bail motion by defense argued and granted by the Court.    
  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for 02-06-2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Cornell L Hutchison in court with attorney Anne Jaspers for Mary D. Scholle.  Defendant Cornell L Hutchison in custody.  Denis John Stingl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state:Mary Schmitz-MPD Detective.  Court took judicial notice of certified documents regarding case #99CF2903 that are attached to the complaint.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and pleads not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 07.  Scheduling conference scheduled for January 20, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for January 20, 2015 at 08:30 am.
DEMAND FOR DISCOVERY

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Cornell L Hutchison in court with attorney Mary D. Scholle.  Defendant Cornell L Hutchison in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge McAdams, Branch 7.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 15, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
